articles.title: Google's Chances Of Fines In Search, AdTech Lawsuits 'Relatively Low': Analyst
articles.content: According to an analyst, Alphabet (Google) may not face significant penalties in two out of three antitrust lawsuits it is currently facing, as the likelihood of fines or penalties is 'relatively low'.

articles.title: Wireless Charging Market to Excel USD 35.52 billion by 2031 | SkyQuest
articles.content: The global wireless charging market is projected to reach $35.52 billion by 2031, driven by the increasing adoption of electric vehicles and the growing demand for convenient device charging in the electronics industry.

articles.title: Only 1 Vanguard Sector ETF Is Down More Than 5% From Its 52-Week High. Here's What That Means for Investors in Value, Dividend, and Growth Stocks.
articles.content: The article discusses the current state of the stock market, where most Vanguard sector ETFs are down less than 5% from their 52-week highs, indicating a broader market rally rather than one driven by a few sectors. The article provides insights for investors in value, dividend, and growth stocks.

articles.title: Will Nvidia Be Worth More Than Apple by 2030?
articles.content: Nvidia's business has surged due to its dominance in AI chips, with its stock price climbing over 760% since last year. The company is now the second most valuable in the world, and it could surpass Apple as the most valuable by 2030 if it continues to outperform the tech giant in growth and cash flow.

articles.title: Was Warren Buffett's Big Sale of Apple Stock a Bet on Kamala Harris Beating Donald Trump?
articles.content: Warren Buffett sold a significant portion of Berkshire Hathaway's stake in Apple, likely due to anticipation of higher corporate taxes, not because of Kamala Harris' plans. However, the timing of the sale may not have been optimal, as Apple is poised to launch its first generative AI functionality, which could drive strong iPhone sales.

articles.title: iPhone 17 Pro Max To Feature 12GB DRAM And Upgraded Cooling System, Says Prominent Apple Tipster: Souped-Up AI Capabilities Likely To Be A 'Major Selling Point'
articles.content: Renowned analyst Ming-Chi Kuo has revealed major improvements for Apple's iPhone 17 Pro Max, including 12GB DRAM, an upgraded cooling system, and enhanced on-device AI capabilities, which are expected to be a major selling point.
